thread.title: These Women Are Kicking Ass and Taking Names During Trump's Presidency
thread.title_full: These Women Are Kicking Ass and Taking Names During Trump's Presidency

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: These Women Are Kicking Ass and Taking Names During Trump's Presidency
text:
has been busy during his first weeks in office. Republicans (and even some Democrats) in Congress — the majority of them white and male — have so far supported the president's agenda, almost uniformly voting in line with Trump-approved policies.
But the opposition is here, and it is female.
 Trump made enemies of women early in his campaign — some might say before that — by dismissing, insulting, and demeaning them in speeches and tweets and leaked tapes. Dissent has been loud and widespread, but notably, it's been women who have taken the boldest stances against the president.
As Rebecca Traister writes in The Cut , "It must be galling for a man who has been so open about his disregard for women to find that the strongest pushback to his administration so far has come from a bunch of women who appear more than a little unimpressed by President Trump, his appointees, and his executive orders."
Here are some of the women who have been fearless in the time since Trump took power:
Sally Yates
